section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Passenger" means an individual who is traveling by railroad vehicle with lawful authorization and who does not participate in the operation of the railroad vehicle.
"Railroad" means a form of ground transportation that runs on rails or electromagnetic guide ways.

"Railroad" includes:
a commuter or other short-haul railroad passenger service in a metropolitan or suburban area; and
a high-speed ground transportation system that connects metropolitan areas.

"Railroad" does not include:
highway ground transportation; or
a rapid transit operation in a metropolitan area that does not connect to the general railroad transportation system.
"Railroad carrier" means a person who provides railroad transportation.
"Railroad property" means the material, equipment, and property used on or in connection with a railroad, right-of-way, or yard.

"Right-of-way" means the track or roadbed that is:
owned, leased, or operated by a railroad carrier;
located on either side of the tracks of the railroad carrier; and
readily recognizable to a reasonable person as railroad property; or
reasonably identified as railroad property by fencing or appropriate signs.

"Yard" means a system of parallel tracks, crossovers, and switches where railroad vehicles are switched or connected, and where railroad vehicles and other rolling stock are kept when not in use or when awaiting repair.
Without the consent of the railroad carrier or other lawful authorization, a person may not ride on the outside or inside of a railroad vehicle, including a flatbed or container.
A person who violates this subsection is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 6 months or a fine not exceeding $1,000 or both.

Without the consent of the railroad carrier or other lawful authorization, and except to cross the property at a public highway or other authorized crossing, a person may not knowingly enter or remain on railroad property.
A person who violates this subsection is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 30 days or a fine not exceeding $100 or both.
